briefdescription.para: Map file as read-only (default); always used on non-Linux fallback.
Best-effort request for THP (MADV_HUGEPAGE) after mapping.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *path, const void **out_addr, size_t *out_len, int *out_is_fallback, int flags)
memberdef.name: ie_mmap_open

briefdescription.para: Map a file into memory (read-only) or fall back to a malloc buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
On Linux:
Opens path with O_RDONLY; mmaps it with PROT_READ.
When flags includes IE_MMAP_F_POPULATE, it:
issues posix_fadvise(..., WILLNEED) (best-effort),
enables MAP_POPULATE if available,
calls readahead(2) as a further best-effort hint.
When flags includes IE_MMAP_F_HUGEPAGE, applies MADV_HUGEPAGE through the mmap-tuning helper after a successful mmap.

On non-Linux platforms or when mmap fails:
Reads the whole file into a heap buffer (64-byte aligned).
Sets *out_is_fallback = 1 so callers may free() it via ie_mmap_close.

parameterdescription.para: Output pointer to mapped or allocated region.
Output byte length of the region.
Output flag set to 1 when malloc fallback is used.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative errno-like value on failure.

briefdescription.para: Apply access pattern advice to a mapped region (best-effort).

detaileddescription.para: Internally forwards to ie_mmap_advise() from the mmap-tuning module. Non-Linux platforms simply ignore the request and return 0.

simplesect.para: 0 on success (or unsupported); negative value on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *addr, size_t len, size_t stride, int verify, uint64_t *out_sum)
memberdef.name: ie_mmap_touch

briefdescription.para: Touch pages across a region with the given stride to enforce warm-up.

detaileddescription.para: The routine performs a volatile read at fixed strides to prevent the compiler from optimizing away the loop. It forwards to ie_mmap_prefault_touch_ro for consistency with other modules.

parameterdescription.para: Stride in bytes (use >= 1; 4096 is a reasonable default).
When non-zero, returns a checksum to keep side effects.
Optional output for the checksum (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative value on invalid arguments.

briefdescription.para: Unmap or free a region previously returned by ie_mmap_open.

parameterdescription.para: 1 if malloc fallback was used, 0 for true mmap path.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative value on failure.

briefdescription.para: Portable file loader with an mmap-first strategy and safe fallbacks.

detaileddescription.para:
This module provides:
Read-only memory mapping of files (Linux: mmap, others: buffered read).
Best-effort page advice (WILLNEED, RANDOM, SEQUENTIAL, HUGEPAGE) through the centralized mmap-tuning helpers.
Optional readahead priming and a page-touch routine for warm-up.

The API is intentionally minimal and self-contained; it does not depend on engine-specific structures. Callers can:
use ie_mmap_open to obtain a RO view of a file,
optionally call ie_mmap_advise to refine access patterns,
optionally call ie_mmap_touch to prefault pages,
finally call ie_mmap_close to release resources.
